arm_group.description: Patients in this arm receive video consultation from physician at the emergency medical dispatch center
Patients receiving prehospital care by ambulance personnel whom receive telephone consultation/supervision by physician at the emergency medical dispatch center.

brief_summary.textblock:
The prehospital resources are limited. The emergency medical dispatch center (EMDC) is
      manned by qualified health care personnel around the clock. We believe that the EMDC is an
      unexploited resource in the prehospital treatment  of patients. By the use of
      videoconferencing we will activate this resource.

      Mobile videoconferencing between ambulances and physician at the EMDC enables patient
      consultation at a distance. Video consultation between patient and the physician at the EMDC
      can take place when the patient is at home or in the ambulance.

      The primary aim of this study is to examine the effect of video consultation between
      physicians at the EMDC and patients receiving treatment by ambulance personnel on the number
      of patients receiving final treatment  on-site in the pre hospital setting.

clinical_study.brief_title: Videoconferencing Between Ambulances and Physician at the Emergency Medical Dispatch Center, Effects on On-Site Patient Treatment and Patterns of Referral

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Less ill/slightly injured  patients receiving prehospital care by ambulance personnel

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

other_name: For video consultation Apple iPad AIR 4G/3G 16GB will be used.
LifeSizeClearSea solution will be used for videoconferencing

facility.name: Prehospital Emergency Medical Services, Aarhus, Central Denmark Region

clinical_study.official_title: Telemedical Solutions in Medical Emergencies, Advantages and Disadvantages for Patients, Healthcare Professionals, and Healthcare System. Study 2: Videoconferencing Between Ambulances and Physician at the Emergency Medical Dispatch Center,

other_outcome.description: Is investigated by the use of survey
other_outcome.measure: Ambulance staff evaluation of usability of equipment
other_outcome.time_frame: At the time of using the equipment, asessed up to 36 months, presented up to 36 months

other_outcome.description: Is evaluated by the use of survey
other_outcome.measure: Physicians evaluation of usability of equipment
other_outcome.time_frame: At the time of using the equipment, assessed up to 36 months, presented up to 36 months

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients receiving final treatment on-site prehospitally
primary_outcome.time_frame: Final treatment is registered for the present consultation, assessed up 36 months, presented up to 36 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: For all patients receiving consultation from physician at the dispatch center resulting in final treatment on-site,  number of patients admitted to hospital within 3 days will be assessed.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 3 days of primary contact, assessed up to 36 months, presented up to 36 months

secondary_outcome.description: If the department to receive the patient is changed during consultation with physician at the dispatch center.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: If destination for patient is changed during  consultataion with physician, assessed up to 36 months, presented up to 36 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of treatments delivered by ambulance personnel
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The number of treatments delivered by ambulance personnel during consultation with physician at the dispatch center, assessed up to 36 months, presented up to 36 months

secondary_outcome.description: If the mode of transportation is changed during consultation with physician at the dispatch center. Eg. from ambulance to standard patient transportation without monitoring og the possibility of treatment, ether with patient sitting up or lying down.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: If mode of transportation is changed during consultation with physician, assessed up to 36 months, presented up to 36 months

collaborator.agency: Prehospital Medical Emergency Services, Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Research Center for Emergency Medicine, University of Aarhus, Denmark

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
